OPEN EVENINGS

A musing harper sings with silver strings
A melody of tender memories,
Singing an unheard song.
The youth of surging multitudes he brings,
Misty with sweetness, mellowed by long days—
Lifetimes short and long,
Hallowed by strivings, soft with time-dried tears,
Melodious with many mingled chords:
An old and unknown song,
Half lost,—a memory of memory,
Singing a strain unutterably sweet—
As sweet as love and long.
His melody is musing memory;
He sings in thoughts too sweet for utterance;
He sings a silent song..

OPEN EVENINGS

A musing harper sings with silver strings
A melody of tender memories,
Singing an unheard song.
The youth of surging multitudes he brings,
Misty with sweetness, mellowed by long days—
Lifetimes short and long,
Hallowed by strivings, soft with time-dried tears,
Melodious with many mingled chords:
An old and unknown song,
Half lost,—a memory of memory,
Singing a strain unutterably sweet—
As sweet as love and long.
His melody is musing memory;
He sings in thoughts too sweet for utterance;
He sings a silent song..
